text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen so with christmas 
coming up i thought i should share with you some

thai christmas recipes but turns out there's no 
such thing because we don't celebrate christmas

in thailand so what i thought i would do instead 
was give you different ways that you can tie up

your leftover christmas roast whether 
you have roast turkey roast chicken

roast beef roast tofu roast vegetables whatever 
it happens to be all of these ways are going to

work so they're not really exact recipes that i'm 
going to give you because everybody's going to end

up with different leftovers but they're all ideas 
that you can totally apply so our first tie up

idea is we're gonna yum it or we're going to laab 
it yes yum and laab are both types of thai salad

what i'm going to do today is closer to a lab than 
a yum but it doesn't matter just the idea that

that matters the most so what i've got here is 
just some roast turkey actually that i made the

other day and i just shredded it up i warmed it 
up just so it's not fridge cold anymore you want

this to be you know not cold and we're going to 
start by making the dressing so in my mixing bowl

i'm going to add some lime juice so as i said this 
is not an exact recipe but i'm going to give you a

rough ratio you want to do one part lime juice to 
one part fish sauce for this and lime juice fish

sauce is the start of every thai salad if you want 
to do this vegan wait a minute we're doing turkey

so this is definitely not vegan but if you were 
to do it vegan you can use soy sauce instead

okay so that's just about roughly one to 
one and then for this i'm gonna add just a

little bit of sugar just to balance out all that 
sharpness and i'm just using light brown sugar

maybe a little bit more if i weren't lazy 
because it's like day after christmas dinner

i might use palm sugar i'm just gonna stir that 
until the sugar is mostly dissolved and then

super super important i'm gonna add some chilies 
and this i'm telling you you want because you know

christmas dinner isn't something spicy it's going 
to be heavy rich and cloying and so the bright

the spicy all of this stuff is going to be key 
okay i'm going to add some shallots or in this

case thinly julian red onions which is a great 
substitute for shallots we usually use shallots

in thailand but i happen to have half a red 
onion in the fridge and i needed to use it up so

and then my chicken turkey leftover is gonna 
this will work beautifully with beef as well or

actually roast vegetables or your roast tofu and 
then some toasted rice powder this is so important

right here and this is what's going to make mine 
more of a lab than a yum you can omit it but i

highly highly recommend it it's super easy i've 
made it many many times you take uncooked rice put

in a saute pan i like to throw in a magrude lime 
leaf in there as well just for aroma you can throw

in some lemongrass if you want cook that over 
medium-high heat until it's nice and golden brown

no not golden deep deep brown and then you're done 
grind it up in a morton pestle or coffee grinder

and there you have it magic powder right here okay 
we're gonna use it actually in a couple different

recipes today so that already looks good and then 
i'm gonna add some fresh mint and cilantro boom

boom boom and then this is like leftover so you 
can start throwing other things that you have

as well whatever herbs you have even if you have 
dill for some reason would go well green onions

what else would go even if you have 
like non-thai herbs like tarragon

would probably work really well and because 
we were freestyling it i need to taste it

so good you can't go wrong i don't 
even need a recipe at this point

does that combination is just guaranteed to be 
delicious and it's spicy and tart and sour with

the mint leaves it's fresh it's better than 
the actual christmas dinner i'm telling you

you got some sticky rice on the side and 
you wish you'd actually done this for dinner

for the second idea you can thumb 
it so tom is a thai term for

boiling and it's also what we call our soups 
and you can turn it in any kind of soup tom yum

so what i'll show you today is the basic tom yum 
but then i'll kind of talk you through different

variations and also i'll put more details on 
other types of soups that you can turn this into

in the written recipe on the website okay linked 
below so i've got here some turkey stock and it

could be chicken stock i'm using unsalted which is 
preferred i wouldn't use store-bought beef stock

though because store-bought beef stock is has 
a really intense flavor and it's not going to

quite work so if you're going to use store-bought 
stick with chicken stock unsalted preferably this

was just turkey bones that i boiled for a few 
hours i'm going to bring this to a boil and

then our herbs the classic tom yum trinity which 
are also the same herbs that you add in tongkat

like all those stones use the same herbs okay 
so i got lemongrass which you've smashed i've

smashed i've got galangal which i've thinly sliced 
and these are frozen and also magrude lime leaves

so the lemongrass galangal are going to go right 
in look at that oh and it instantly smells good

and then with the lime leaves i'm going to bruise 
and tear them first just give it a nice bruise and

tear and by the way i do freeze these as well 
and the bruising will help the flavor comes out

for spiciness i am using some thai chilies 
which as you can tell i keep mine frozen as well

i don't want to finely chop this because 
i just want it to gently infuse so i'm

just going to add it to my morton pestle 
and just pound them so they're bruised

but then they're still whole so 
that way no one gets a surprise bite

of super spicy heat but it's still infusing 
some chili flavor and heat into there gently

and people can just eat around it if 
they want okay so we will let that simmer

for about five minutes oh and if you want to make 
this a tomka by the way you just do maybe two part

stock and one part coconut milk i'm gonna season 
this with some fish sauce and again because we are

freestyling it today i'm just gonna glug 
glug glug glug which means i need to taste

oh good oh that's spicy a little bit more that's 
good and i'm also gonna add a touch of sugar

and i'm gonna do just light brown sugar because 
again this is lazy cooking it's leftover dinner

we don't need a lot of work here you can just 
do granulated sugar as well it'll totally work

fine so now my broth the season i'm going 
to add my vegetables now you can throw in

normally i'd say throw in any kind of vegetables 
you've got left over but it might mess with the

flavor so i stick with something a little more 
neutral so mushrooms are classic so i got oyster

mushrooms here which i love you can do any kind 
of asian mushrooms no button mushrooms i say this

every time i make a soup and then people keep 
sending me pictures of their tom yum with button

mushrooms and they say i know you said no button 
mushrooms but i made mine with button mushrooms

that's fine it's your soup okay so the 
mushrooms are going in and they just

need about a minute to cook our meat is already 
done so i'm just going to add them at the end

heat it up and then kill the heat because you 
don't want to overcook the meat in the soup

right so give that a minute okay so the mushrooms 
have softened a bit and if you are not doing tomka

i also like adding tomatoes and i say not 
doing tonka because tomatoes and coconut

that might be good but it's just not something 
that we add to tomka but it could be good you

can try it but if you're making tom yum then 
tomatoes make a great addition so i'm going to

add them in and also i'm going to add my leftover 
meat of your choice so there's our turkey going in

there we go now that just needs to heat through 
oh by the way you don't eat the lemongrass you

don't eat the galangal and you don't eat the 
magurt lime leaves those are there just for

garnishes you can take them out if 
you want but you'll have a heck of

a time trying to chew through that okay 
turkey is heated through now i'm going to

turn my heat off because i do not like to cook 
my lime juice which is the next thing we're

gonna add and this soup is sour and spicy so 
you do want quite a bit of lime juice in there

okay i'm gonna do all of my limes here because 
now i'm going to taste this one more time

oh oh that's so comforting oh a little bit 
more cilantro you can do green onions for

10 of you out there who are opposed to cilantro 
and that's it beautiful tom yum leftover

christmas it even looks christmassy 
look yeah you're left for christmas

oh my god look how cute it's like it's all 
the right colors it's all the right colors

next we are going to tell it and dell is short 
for nam tim dao which is a dipping sauce that we

use for just about all of our roasted grilled 
barbecued meats it's good on like everything

this is a really good one if you have a beautiful 
roast that you really don't like you're really

happy with the way it tastes it was perfectly 
cooked you don't want to mess with it but you want

something a little different just keep it as is 
put different dipping sauce on it okay i've mixed

out several times before but here's a general idea 
i'm going to use palm sugar this time actually

because i can conveniently pound it in a mortar 
and pestle which will help it dissolve quickly i'm

just going to pound that to break it down further 
of course brown sugar works light brown sugar

so i've just sort of broken down the big pieces 
into a really thick kind of paste powdery thing

and then i'm going to add fish sauce and 
once you add the liquid that'll dissolve

the ratio for this it's up to you if you want more 
of a sweet and salty dipping sauce or you want

you know more salty and sour and not 
a lot of sweet you can totally adjust

so see once a little bit of liquid goes in then 
all of a sudden the sugar dissolves really quickly

and then i'm going to add lime juice so the ratio 
for lime to fish sauce is about equal parts just

like the salad but it is the sugar that you can 
vary and also if now you have some tamarind paste

now is the time to use it do like half tamarind 
half lime and you get a dipping sauce that's a

little thicker a little richer but i don't 
have tamarind right now pylin doesn't have

tamarind no i don't actually right now um so i'm 
just gonna do a lime okay give that a good mix

nice i'm going to add some julienne shallots so 
if you can do this a little bit ahead of time

and give the shallots some time to sort of like 
infuse that would be nice chili flakes this is

thai roasted chili flakes all that means you 
take dried chilies you roast it in the oven

for five minutes or you can put it under under the 
broiler for literally like 30 seconds to a minute

until it gets dark and smoky grind it up or you 
can just use any old chili flakes that you have

but when you roast it you get a smoky chili 
flake which adds a nice flavor now the key to tau

toasted rice powder again hello we keep seeing you 
and you want to add this sort of close to serving

time because otherwise it'll just kind of swell 
up absorb all the liquid not a terrible thing but

it's better if it's fresh you can add quite a lot 
there it smells good let me just taste this first

oh that's good oh that's good spicy okay into 
our little dip dipping bowl here and then

some greenery you can do cilantro and mint 
which is sort of my favorite okay and that

is pretty much it looks so good let's plate this 
up so here's the rest of my turkey breast that

i roasted and did not cut up so this is good 
for meat that you you know like not just bits

that you picked off the bone but whole pieces 
and you can do nice presentations so i'm just

going to cut it oh and this if you have roast 
beef this is perfect because you don't have to

risk losing the beautiful cooking job that you've 
got let's bring our plate here and on the plate

we already have sticky rice which is what you 
want to serve when you're having some meats with

dough sticky rice is really the way to go and if 
you want to know how to cook sticky rice i got

a video with seven different ways to do it so you 
want to check that out i'll link to that below our

little dipping sauce goes right there look at that 
better than the christmas dinner you had yesterday
let me just taste this little bit oh it's so good
don't need anything

easy just make a dip you've transformed your whole 
dinner into something completely different flavor

hey it's keto you can have it oh no i have to 
put sugar in it but that's okay close enough

isn't that so good it makes turkey good 
it makes turkey good what else do you need

so finally we are going to pat eat and pat in 
thai means to stir fry and while you could turn

your leftovers into any kind of stir-fry today i'm 
going to do cow pot which is fried rice because

you really can't talk about leftovers in the 
context of asian food without touching on fried

rice it is the ultimate way to use up leftovers 
okay so i'm gonna do a simple basic fried rice

just to go through the process but know that you 
can throw in all of your roast vegetables bits and

pieces ends of this and that any kind of sauces 
that you want with it and i'll give you a little

tip you know how you have your turkey sitting on 
a plate and then when you're done with it there's

just some liquid sitting on the plate just some 
turkey juice you know that's just been sitting

there save that stuff and you can put it in your 
fried rice for that extra flavor okay so i have

a wok here i'm going to turn it on garlic lots of 
garlic and then heat not too high in the beginning

garlic is starting to brown so i'm gonna add 
some eggs you don't have to stir it right away

if you want that marbled effect but if you want 
homogeneous yellow color just beat it ahead of

time okay now because my leftover turkey is cold 
fridge cold i want to add it early so it has time

to heat up oh and you want to chop it down to 
bite-size pieces now that we're doing fried rice
there we go okay my heat can come back up up now

get the turkey and the eggs to mingle 
it's like mother and child reunited

okay now the rice going in and i'm going 
to once again debunk the myth that your

rice needs to be cold this literally just came 
out of my rice cooker and if you cook it well

and it's not too mushy it will fry up just 
fine now i'm gonna add our jellified rotisserie

juice and because we added that i'm gonna do a 
little less soy sauce and fish sauce a little

less seasoning because that juice is a little bit 
salty some sugar to balance all that sweetness and

stir-fry away my friends stir-fry away you want 
high heat you want the rice to toast and pop and

i'm not concerned about the extra liquid from the 
chicken juice because i know my rice was dry and

my heat is high i'm not crowding the wok so i am 
not running the risk of having mushy fried rice oh

it smells good already some pepper i'm doing white 
you can do black and i'm almost done look at that

i'm just gonna wait for my rice to toast a bit i 
love how my turkey pieces have already started to

brown as i've mentioned before you want to not 
stir your rice constantly so it has some time

to get toasted and that's it i'm going to turn 
my heat off need some greenery oh of course

vegetables if you have some firmer vegetables 
add them in earlier if you only have just green

onions you can just add them in at the end 
and just like that you have beautiful thai

leftover christmas fried rice look at that 
um and this again would work with beef

or if all you had was just vegetables this 
would also work with just vegetables and then

classic garnishes for some freshness you put 
some cucumber that you might have from your

salads from yesterday some lime because with 
thai fried rice we always like a little splash

of lime and some extra badly chopped cilantro 
that i rushed through because i forgot about

but you get the idea put some more green stuff 
on top it's pretty yay look at that let me try it

i'm curious to see how the 
rotisserie chicken juice

works with this oh i forgot my lime what am 
i talking about what am i doing there we go

oh that's good every time i have this fried 
rice it brings me back to childhood thailand

days because a basic fried rice like this is 
so popular with kids because it's simple it's

delicious there's no too much vegetables that kids 
don't like so this flavor to me just like reminds

me of childhood and that rotisserie chicken 
juice is perfect in it it adds a little bit of a

chickeny flavor that i wouldn't have normally 
so definitely save all that liquid that your

turkey gives off while it's sitting on the table 
and that is it how amazing is that that you can

turn something like this from the day before 
into all of these and even more hey these were

so easy you can make all of them and have a whole 
other feast because they were so easy so the full

written recipe will be on hot thaikitchen.com a 
special thank you to our patreon members who help

support the show if you want to know more about 
that i'll put the link in the description below

have a happy and safe holiday season and i will 
see you next time for your next delicious time
